title: Student Activities
content: Students of the Applied Bachelor's in Land Transportation Management program engage in various activities that support academic and professional skills development. These activities include traffic management simulations, training in transportation data analysis using modern software, and visits to terminals, inland ports, and logistics companies. Students are also active in transportation-related seminars and workshops, as well as community service activities such as traffic safety education. Additionally, students participate in research and land transportation innovation projects, contributing tangible benefits to society. These activities prepare students to apply their knowledge directly in the workplace.
